item.description: Date: Wednesday, March 26, 2025 10:30 AM - 4:00 PM - Open Data & AI Hackathon is a community-run, one-day in-person Get Together event focused on intensive problem solving in collaborative setting. item.title: Computer Science Colloquia: Ali Vakilian - Algorithms in the AI Age | March 24
item.description: Date: Monday, March 24, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Ali Vakilian is a Research Assistant Professor at TTIC. His research interests include fairness of algorithms and machine learning, learning-augmented algorithms, and algorithms for massive data. Ali received his Ph.D. from MIT EECS, where he was advised by Erik Demaine and Piotr Indyk. He completed his MS studies at UIUC where he was a recipient of the Siebel Scholar award. He is a recipient of the Outstanding Student Paper Highlight Award at AISTATS 2024.Where: CII 3206

item.title: Computer Science Colloquia: Clayton Thomas - Explaining Matching Mechanisms to Participants | March 26
item.description: Date: Wednesday, March 26, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Clayton Thomas is a postdoctoral researcher in the Economics and Computation group at Microsoft Research, New England. His work focuses on theoretical computer science and economic design: striving to build systems that perform well under strategic incentives. He completed his PhD in the computer science theory group at Princeton University, where he was awarded the Wallace Memorial Fellowship in Engineering and a Siebel Scholar award.

item.title: Do you know RPI’s Mission and Goals?
item.description: Did you know our new Rensselaer Forward Plan carries forward our founder’s mission: to instruct “persons who may choose to apply themselves in the application of science to the common purposes of life”? The mission, vision, and core values of RPI are outlined alongside the former Rensselaer Plan 2024 and the new Rensselaer Forward Plan. For more details, dive into Standard 1 of RPI’s Self-Study for Middle States Accreditation, a team led by Dr. Lee Ligon and Ms. Colleen Smith.

item.title: iEAR Presents! Dr. Theresa Jean Tanenbaum: Transformative Play Lab | March 26 (Virtual Event)
item.description: In this talk, Dr. Theresa Jean Tanenbaum theorizes an emancipatory design practice intended to restore agency and power to those of us who have suffered at the hands of the oppressive normative social order (which is to say, most of us). She illustrates this with a vulnerable autoethnographic discussion of her own experiences of gender transition, and with examples from larp, tabletop roleplaying games, and popular media. Join virtually on 3/26 at 7pm.

item.description: Date: 3/24/2025 2:30 PM to 3:30 PM Join us as we celebrate the grand opening of RPI’s new small modular reactor control room simulator in the NuScale Energy Exploration Laboratory (NEEL). The opening event will take place on Monday, March 24, from 2:30 – 3:30 p.m. in the Jonsson Engineering Center (JEC), Room 2027, on RPI’s campus.
